body_html: aselle's point is that you can change the makefile to build a static library for Android, or any other system. However, a lot of the TF Lite operators depend on neon, which is available on Android but not on every other system. If you don't have neon (or a suitable replacement) you will have to manually edit the source code in kernels/*.cc. (On linux you may sometimes rely on sse as a neon replacement)

body: aselle's point is that you can change the makefile to build a static library for Android, or any other system. However, a lot of the TF Lite operators depend on neon, which is available on Android but not on every other system. If you don't have neon (or a suitable replacement) you will have to manually edit the source code in kernels/*.cc. (On linux you may sometimes rely on sse as a neon replacement)
